#math #work #highmath 
# Finite Difference Theory
$\lim \limits_{ h \to 0}\frac{ f(x+h) - f(x) }{ h } = f'(x)$

$\frac{ f(x+h) - f(x) }{ h } \approx f'(x)$
## Analytical
$f' = f$
$f(0) = 1$
Solution: $f(x) = e^x$
## Finite difference
### Forward method
$\frac{ f(x+h)-f(x) }{ h } = f(x)$
$f(0) = 1$

#### Transform equation
Multiply both parts by $h$ and add $f(x)$
$f(x+h)=(1+h)f(x)$
$f(0) = 1$

#### Solve continuously
$f(0) = 1;$
$f(h) = (1+h)*f(0) = (1+h)$
$f(2h) = (1+h)f(h) = (1+h)^2$
$f(3h) = (1+h)f(2h) = (1+h)^3$
...
$f(n*h) = (1+h)^n$

#### Replace a variable
$f(x_k) \approx f_k \text{ where } x_k = k*h$ 

#### Determine a sequence
$f_{k+1} = (1+h)*f_k$
$f_0 = 1$

#### Importance of the value of $h$:
##### $h=0.5$
###### Using finite differences
$f_0 = 1$
$f_1 = (1+0.5)*f_0 = 1.5$
$f_2 = (1+0.5)*f_1 = 1.5*1.5 = 2.25$
$f_3 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 1.5*2.25 = 3.375$
$f_4 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 5.0625$
$f_5 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 7.59375$
$f_6 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 11.390625$
$f_7 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 17.0859375$
$f_8 = (1+0.5)*f_2 = 25.62890625$
...
###### Using analytical solution
$f(x) = e^x$
$f_0 = f(0) = 1$
$f_1 = f(0.5) = 1.6487212707001282$
$f_2 = f(1.0) = 2.718281828459045$
$f_3 = f(1.5) = 4.4816890703380645$
$f_4 = f(2.0) = 7.38905609893065$
$f_5 = f(2.5) = 12.182493960703473$
$f_6 = f(3.0) = 20.085536923187668$
$f_7 = f(3.5) = 33.11545195869231$
$f_8 = f(4.0) = 54.598150033144236$
..

##### $h = 0.1$
###### Using finite differences
$f_0 = 1$
$f_1 = (1+0.1)*f_0 = 1.1$
$f_2 = (1+0.1)*f_1 = 1.1*1.1 = 1.21$
...
$f_{40} = (1+0.1)*f_39 = 45.25925556817607$

###### Using analytical solution
$f(x) = e^x$
$f_0 = f(0) = 1$
$f_1 = f(0.1) = 1.1051709180756477$
$f_2 = f(0.2) = 1.2214027581601699$
...
$f_{40} = f(4.0) = 54.598150033144236$
